      • insertCustomerPasswordHistory

        int insertCustomerPasswordHistory(AdminCustomerPasswordHistory custPwdHist)
                           throws KKAdminException
        Inserts a customer password history record
        Parameters:
        custPwdHist - the AdminCustomerPasswordHistory record to insert
        Returns:
        the id of the newly-inserted record
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

        void deleteCustomerPasswordHistoryById(int id)
                                throws KKAdminException
        Delete a customer password history record
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the AdminCustomerPasswordHistory record to delete
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • updateCustomerPasswordHistory

        void updateCustomerPasswordHistory(AdminCustomerPasswordHistory custPwdHist)
                            throws KKAdminException
        Update a customer password history record - the Id and CustId fields are not updated but are used to identify the record to update.
        Parameters:
        custPwdHist - the AdminCustomerPasswordHistory record to update
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • getCustomerPasswordHistory

        AdminCustomerPasswordHistory[] getCustomerPasswordHistory(int userId,
                                                          int maxRows)
                                                   throws KKAdminException
        Get a maximum of maxRows CustomerPasswordHistory records belonging to the specified userId. The results will be ordered by dateCreated descending so if maxRows is 1 only the most recent CustomerPasswordHistory is returned.
        Parameters:
        userId - the userId whose records to return
        maxRows - a maximum of this many records will be returned
        Returns:
        an array of CustomerPasswordHistory records, ordered by dateCreated descending
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • checkPasswordValidity

        boolean checkPasswordValidity(java.lang.String password,
                              int userId)
                       throws KKAdminException
        Is the password valid?
        Parameters:
        password - the new Password to check for validity
        userId - the user that the password belongs to
        Returns:
        true if the password is valid otherwise an exception is thrown
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if there's an unexpected problem or the password is found to be invalid. If the password is found to be invalid the msgKey attribute of the KKAdminException will contain a message catalogue key that references a message that explains why.

      • hasPasswordExpired

        boolean hasPasswordExpired(java.lang.String password,
                           int userId)
                    throws KKAdminException
        Has the customer's password expired?
        Parameters:
        password - password in plain text
        userId - the user that the password belongs to
        Returns:
        true if the password has expired
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • hasPasswordBeenUsedBefore

        boolean hasPasswordBeenUsedBefore(java.lang.String newPassword,
                                  int userId)
                           throws KKAdminException
        Has the new password been used before?
        Parameters:
        newPassword - the new password that to check
        userId - the user that the password belongs to
        Returns:
        true if the password has been used before
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • prunePasswordHistory

        void prunePasswordHistory(int userId)
                   throws KKAdminException
        Prune old CustomerPasswordHistory records. Since we only check up to a certain number of records in the history as defined in the konakartadmin.properties file we need to prune away the records we no longer need.
        Parameters:
        userId - the userId of the records to prune
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • refreshConfigs

        void refreshConfigs()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Refresh the configuration of the Manager
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • userPasswordNeverExpires

        boolean userPasswordNeverExpires(java.lang.String user)
        Is this a user whose password never expires?
        Parameters:
        user - the username to check
        Returns:
        true if the uer's password never expires
